summary: a man stands on a clump of land on hokkaido island , japan . geologists believe the emergence is a result of a landslide nearby . the mass has risen some 30 to 50ft above sea level , measures roughly 1,000 - 1,640 ft long , and 100ft wide . the extra stretch of coastline has risen as high as 50ft from the sea surface .

explain: The core idea of this aspect is that there was an unexpected rise of seabed along Hokkaido Island's coastline due to a landslide. Geologists believe that this rise in seabed is due to the landslide that occurred near the coast. As a result, a mass of land has emerged and risen from 30 to 50 feet above sea level, measuring roughly 1,000 to 1,640 feet long and 100 feet wide. This has created an extra stretch of coastline that is now 50 feet above sea level.

The given aspect suggests that the emergence of the clump of land on Hokkaido island, Japan is a result of a landslide. Geologists believe that the land has risen 30 to 50ft above sea level due to a landslide and the extra stretch of coastline has risen as high as 50ft from the sea surface. This indicates that the landslide is the cause of the emergence of the land.

The given aspect highlights the surprise of the locals to the emergence of the new stretch of land due to the landslide that occurred near Hokkaido Island in Japan. They witnessed the rise of the land some 50ft from the sea surface and the formation of a new clump of land as a result of the geological phenomenon.

The given aspect talks about a newly discovered coastline near Rausu town in Hokkaido, Japan. This new coastline was formed due to the emergence of a clump of land that rose as high as 50ft from the sea surface. This emergence is believed to be a result of a landslide nearby and measures roughly 1,000 - 1,640 ft long and 100ft wide.

The given aspect states that the landmass that has emerged on Hokkaido Island, Japan measures 1,000- 1,640ft long, that is, it spans over a length of 1,000 to 1,640 feet and is 100 feet wide. The core idea of this aspect is that the emerged landmass is quite large in terms of its dimensions and covers a considerable area of the island.

The aspect highlights that despite the emergence of land due to a landslide nearby, the residents of Hokkaido Island, Japan did not experience any tremors or hear any sounds. This means that the emergence was not caused by any seismic or volcanic activity, and thus, the residents were not aware of it until it was discovered by geologists.

The given aspect highlights that authorities believe the landslide that caused the mass of land to emerge happened overnight. This implies that the event was sudden and unexpected, and it may have occurred in a relatively short period of time.

Overall, the aspect underscores the potential unpredictability and destructive power of natural events, and the need for preparedness and vigilance in dealing with them.
